intro: Lasiacis procerrima, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. Lasiacis procerrima is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
